title: How does a writer find an illustrator for their graphic novel? - Quora

response.answer_text: I struck up conversations with comics illustrators on Twitter and have had work published with them. Most recently a story of mine was published in the anthology Toronto Comics, vol.3 (Toronto Comics Anthology). I met the illustrator Katie Mackay on Twitter. We’ve published three stories together and have never met in person. Give it a shot.

A writer looking for an artist on a graphic novel is a little bit like a guy at a dance looking for a girl to dance with. If you don't know someone already, you're competing with all the other writers looking for artists. My best advice is to scrutinize your writing and look for the ways in which maybe it's not so awesome. Then fix them so it's awesome.
